verses.roman:
śīta-vātātapa-prāvṛḍ-
himair anyonyataḥ prajāḥ
kṣut-tṛḍbhyāṁ vyādhibhiś caiva
santapsyante ca cintayā

synonyms: śīta—by cold; vāta—wind; ātapa—the heat of the sun; prāvṛt—torrential rain; himaiḥ—and snow; anyonyataḥ—by quarrel; prajāḥ—the citizens; kṣut—by hunger; tṛḍbhyām—and thirst; vyādhibhiḥ—by diseases; ca—also; eva—indeed; santapsyante—they will suffer great distress; ca—and; cintayā—by anxiety.
translation: The citizens will suffer greatly from cold, wind, heat, rain and snow. They will be further tormented by quarrels, hunger, thirst, disease and severe anxiety.
